intro: Sakersia calodendron, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Sakersia calodendron thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
